intro: Lampranthus simulans, commonly known as the yellow firetail, is a member of the Aizoaceae family, native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, which bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has a succulent, fleshy stem and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It thrives in full sun and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Lampranthus simulans is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
